intro: Heracleum lanatum f. rubriflorum, commonly known as the red-flowered cow parsnip, is a flowering plant in the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its tall, erect stems and large, compound leaves that are hairy and lobed. The plant produces clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in umbrella-like inflorescences. It thrives in moist, open habitats such as meadows and streambanks. Its distinctive red-orange flowers distinguish it from other members of the species.
